title: Closing the Adventure Gap
description:
On this episode, we learn about how one woman is working to foster economic equity in the outdoors and how supporting founders of color will improve the outdoor industry for everyone. We hear from founder Patricia Cameron about her nonprofit, Blackpackers, which aims to address the gap in representation in the outdoors by providing gear, outdoor excursions and outdoor education for free or at a subsidized cost. Then, host Carla Harris sits down with Dan Kihanya, REI’s Director of Corporate Development and Racial Equity. Dan explains REI’s latest initiative “Path Ahead Ventures” which was created to invest in founders of color and promote inclusion within the outdoor industry.

 

https://www.morganstanley.com/what-we-do/inclusive-innovation-and-opportunity

itunes:summary: Patricia Cameron and Dan Kihanya share how they’re making the outdoors more accessible to all.
